com.lewitanski.lisa.assignment2

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lewitanski.lisa.assignment2.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    GameBoard.

    This class manage the card. It manage the card's position, value and if it's shows.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Lisa Lewitanski

      • setPositions

        public void setPositions(int left,
                         int top,
                         int right,
                         int bottom)
        This method allows to set the card position with the given position put in parameter to this method.
        Parameters:
        left - : The left position to the card.
        top - : The top position to the card.
        right - : The right position to the card.
        bottom - : The bottom position to the card.
        See Also:

      • isCardTriggered

        public boolean isCardTriggered(int pos_x,
                               int pos_y)
        Given the position of the click, determine wether the user clicked on the card or not.
        Parameters:
        pos_x - : The x position of the click.
        pos_y - : The y position of the click.
        Returns:
        True if card hit, else false.

      • setDown

        public void setDown(boolean status)
        This method allows to set the down status. Down will be true if the user clicks on the card else it will be false.
        Parameters:
        status -
        See Also:

      • showCard

        public void showCard(boolean status)
        This method allows to set the status of the card. If the card is return it will be true, else it will be false.
        Parameters:
        status - : The status card

      • isCardShow

        public boolean isCardShow()
        This method allows to return the status of the card.
        Returns:
        If the card is show it return true, else it return false.

      • getNbTurn

        public boolean getNbTurn()
        This method allows to know if 2 card are already showed. If 2 cards are show, the counter nb_turn will be set to 0.
        Returns:
        : If less 2 card it return true, else it return false.
        See Also:
        getNbTurn()
